conclusion: Use the first law of thermodynamics: ΔU = Q - W.
Given: W = 10 J, AB is parallel to V-axis (isochoric), BC extension passes through origin (isothermal).
AB is parallel to the V-axis, indicating constant volume.
Process from A to B is isochoric (constant volume).
For isochoric process, work done W is zero, but problem states W = 10 J.
Use first law: ΔU = Q - W for isochoric process.
For ideal gas, ΔU = nCvΔT, but for isochoric, ΔU = Q - W.
Relate heat and work: Q = ΔU + W.
For isochoric process, Q = ΔU. Given W = 10 J, assume internal energy change is due to heat.
Heat absorbed by gas from A to B is Q = 30 J.
